title: Redhat 8.4: tikv restart by systemd after set memory-usage-limit less than vm message
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
sh-4.4# /tiup/deploy/tikv-20160/bin/tikv-server -V
TiKV
Release Version:   6.1.0
Edition:           Community
Git Commit Hash:   080d086832ae5ce2495352dccaf8df5d40f30687
Git Commit Branch: heads/refs/tags/v6.1.0
UTC Build Time:    2022-06-10 11:22:39
Rust Version:      rustc 1.60.0-nightly (1e12aef3f 2022-02-13)
Enable Features:   jemalloc mem-profiling portable sse test-engine-kv-rocksdb test-engine-raft-raft-engine cloud-aws cloud-gcp cloud-azure
Profile:           dist_release

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->

### What did you expect?
pod has request 16G memory
		err := tc.UpdateConfig(resource.TiDBClusterUpdateConfigOptions{
			Target: resource.TiKV,
			Config: "memory-usage-limit = \"12G\"\n[storage.block-cache]\ncapacity = \"7G\""})
		return err
	}

### What did happened?
tikv oom and use than 12G.
[2936253.548142] oom-kill:constraint=CONSTRAINT_MEMCG,nodemask=(null),cpuset=cri-containerd-6d9f788aa1549022adddd2d2cd5bcf2c1e6a4376059f5bf95901d9633392db28.scope,mems_allowed=0-1,oom_memcg=/kubepods.slice/kubepods-podb0bd101c_6315_4417_be9c_a2d7c9f3bb9e.slice/cri-containerd-6d9f788aa1549022adddd2d2cd5bcf2c1e6a4376059f5bf95901d9633392db28.scope/system.slice,task_memcg=/kubepods.slice/kubepods-podb0bd101c_6315_4417_be9c_a2d7c9f3bb9e.slice/cri-containerd-6d9f788aa1549022adddd2d2cd5bcf2c1e6a4376059f5bf95901d9633392db28.scope/system.slice/tikv-20160.service,task=tikv-server,pid=2326757,uid=1000
[2936253.548290] Memory cgroup out of memory: Killed process 2326757 (tikv-server) total-vm:19640788kB, anon-rss:15651428kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:0kB, UID:1000 pgtables:32684kB oom_score_adj:-997
[2936254.543814] oom_reaper: reaped process 2326757 (tikv-server), now anon-rss:0kB, file-rss:0kB, shmem-rss:0kB


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9443637/180186429-fc929bb4-9624-45b8-859c-676f2fc30321.png)

comments_data.body: @jebter Has discussed with @mayjiang0203 , She'll reproduce this, then we'll investigate why

After three times try, didn't reproduce oom in dmesg again, but tikv still restart many times.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9443637/185056815-c5b517c3-bba9-4521-8cda-0c3b352ab105.png)



And from systemd log, found that tikv restart by systemd.
```
journalctl -u tikv-20160.service
```

Update, after disable auto restart, run 6 hours, didn't hit tikv reset again. 
Need more time to verify this restart can be fixed by disable systemd auto restart.
@mayjiang0203 After disable auto restart, does the problem exit anymore? If not, we may close it or downgrade the severity.
Yes, after disable auto restart, didn't hit this again.
